page.title: 15The Primary School
page.content: Tattingstone boasts a very tiny primary school. It was built in 1841 and in 1985 it had 47 children on its register.The school consists of two classrooms; one for the infants taught by Mrs Tatchell and the other for juniors taught by Mr Riley. Also helping in the school are Mrs Williams a part time teacher,Mrs Fletcher an ancillary helper,Mrs Dale the caretaker and Mrs Smith the dinner lady. School starts at 8.50 and finishes at 3.20. children from Wherstead are brought to school by coach.In the school grounds is the old masters house which is now utilised as an art room,an environmental studies room,a T.V./video room and a music room. All the children have either packed lunches or school dinners which are served in the junior classroom.
